data.title: Pay my Apple Health premium
data.meta_description: Learn how to pay your Washington Apple Health premium payment and who to contact if you have questions.
data.text:
Some Washington Apple Health programs require a premium payment, including:

Apple Health for Kids with Premiums (commonly referred to as CHIP)

Apple Health for Workers with Disabilities (HWD)

If you have been approved for an Apple Health program that requires you to make a monthly premium payment, you will be mailed a statement from the Office of Financial Recovery (OFR). The statement will tell you the premium amount and provide information on how to pay.

If you receive a letter stating you have been approved for Apple Health coverage, you do not need to wait until a premium bill comes to begin using your services.

How do I pay my Apple Health premium?

Premium payments can be made online or by mail. There is no option to pay over the phone at this time.

Before you can pay your bill online, create a Secure Access Washington (SAW) user account. Once you have a SAW account:

Select apply for "Payment services provided by Department of Social and Health Services for PRM and HWD health insurance."

Follow the prompts to add your bank account.

Online: Secure Access Washington (SAW)

View the SAW - Premium Payment Users Guide (Spanish translation) or contact SAW at 1-855-928-3241 for assistance setting up your SAW account.

Contact OFR at 1-800-562-6114, Option 1, to receive assistance setting up your payment account. Have your statement ready when you call.

By mail:

DSHS Office of Financial Recovery

PO Box 9501

Olympia, WA 98507-9501​

Your premium statement will include a tear off coupon that should be mailed with your payment if you are sending a check or money order.​​

Where can I learn more about my eligibility?
